title: Apple reportedly readying ‘AirPods Pro’ for an imminent launch
text:
This image allegedly shows the incoming ‘AirPods Pro’ (SlashLeaks)

Rumours are beginning to swirl about a new pair of AirPod earphones from Apple that may be called the ‘AirPods Pro’.

Given the tech company already has the MacBook Pro, the iPhone Pro and iPad Pro, it would seem to make sense.

These new earphones are reportedly similar to the existing AirPods but with a shorter, squatter design. They supposedly will have noise-cancelling technology built in and will come in as many as eight different colours. Perhaps in order to match up with the recently-released iPhone 11.

This design appears to reflect images posted on tech site SlashLeaks (pictured above) that allegedly show a prototype version of the new gadgets.

There’s no mention yet of anything like waterproofing or sweat resistance that might be useful for those who want wireless earphones during exercise. Perhaps because Apple-owned Beats by Dre already offers a product exactly like that.

According to serial gadget leaker Benjamin Geskin, the tech giant is showing off the products to select media this week and will unveil them officially in the next couple of weeks.

AirPods Pro will be shown next week on Tuesday / Wednesday at an event / session with journalists at Apple's local offices pic.twitter.com/HFLqpHAGkg — Ben Geskin (@BenGeskin) October 27, 2019

The current AirPods received an updated charging case back in March, but the earbuds themselves were unchanged.

Although they’re on the pricey end of the wireless earbud spectrum, the AirPods have become a massive seller and another hugely popular product for Apple.

If the AirPods Pro are genuine, then there’s every chance they could be just as successful.
